moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. f3: Would be interested to know the reasoning for this weak move standard is Nf3 or c4
moves.2... d5 3. c4: And now one of the cruelties of chess. What was correct last move is wrong this move!! Either Nc3 or having gone with f3 continue with e4
moves.3... c5 4. dxc5: taking this way gives up the centre to white. better was cxd5
moves.4... e5: slightly better for me was e6 protecting d5
moves.5. b4: too many pawn moves without developing your pieces cxd5 undoubles your pawns
moves.5... a5 6. Qa4+: It is no use attacking with oe piece which can easily be defended. again cxd5 was correct
moves.6... Bd7 7. b5 Bxc5 8. cxd5: what was the correct move now becomes the game losing move. It allows Bd4 threatening to win the R Better was to withdraw the Q to c2 for defensive purposes
moves.8... Bd4 9. Qxd4: And now to give up your Q to save a R is game over
